article_text:
A Democrat told the CCIIO head to get colleagues timely answers. (AP photo/Jacquelyn Martin)

House Republicans have been calling Obama administration officials over for a new round of hearings on the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) commercial health insurance programs.

Republicans repeatedly blasted the administration officials over the recent announcement that HealthCare.gov sent customers about 800,000 inaccurate 1095-A coverage information notices.

article_metadata.sailthru.author: Allison Bell
article_metadata.description: The House held a few hearings that touched on the health law this week.

article_summary:
Republicans repeatedly blasted the administration officials over the recent announcement that HealthCare.gov sent customers about 800,000 inaccurate 1095-A coverage information notices.
(AP photo/Jacquelyn Martin)House Republicans have been calling Obama administration officials over for a new round of hearings on the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (PPACA) commercial health insurance programs.
A Democrat told the CCIIO head to get colleagues timely answers.
